page.title: 01The Area in General.
page.content: We live in a very hilly area. The main feature of our 12km block is our magnificent hills. Some of them are rocky and steep,but some are gradually sloping hills covered in heather, whimberries and gorse. Another feature of our block is the {planted}forests. A lot of the forest is planted for timber by the Forestry Commission but some is oak,planted for its bark used in the tanning process. The villages of Snailbeach and Stiperstones grew when people found there were rich minerals in this area and mining communities developed. The main type of farming is sheep farming. Most of our land-cover is rough grazing and sheep are the best type of animal to live on it. Some farmers rear cattle for beef but a few farmers rear dairy cows, one being the local milkman.
